get.summary: Read a single access profile provisioning link by id
get.description: Returns the access profile provisioning link identified by the id.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

delete.summary: Deletes an access profile provisioning link
delete.description: Deletes the access profile provisioning link identified by the id.

get.summary: Query for access profile provisioning in Topicus KeyHub
get.description: Query for all access profile provisioning links in Topicus KeyHub. The various query parameters can be used to filter the response.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Return all or no records. This can be useful when composing parameters.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created after the given instant.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created before the given instant.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the given ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter the results on the given ids.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description: Only return records that have been modified since the given instant.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter records on a complex CQL query.

parameters.name: accessProfile
parameters.description: Filter access profile provisioning links on the given access profiles, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the access profile resource.

parameters.name: groupOnSystem
parameters.description: Filter access profile provisioning links on the given group on systems, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group on system resource.

parameters.name: groupOnSystemOwnerGroup
parameters.description: Only return access profile provisioning links for which one of the given groups is the owner of its group on system, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the groups resource.

parameters.name: ownedBy
parameters.description: Filter access profile provisioning links for which the given groups are owner, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the access profile resource.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: Only return access profile provisioning links that are provisionined on one of the given systems, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the systems resource.

parameters.name: systemAdminGroup
parameters.description: Only return access profile provisioning links for which one of the given groups is technical administrator for the system of its group on system, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the groups resource.

parameters.name: systemContentAdminGroup
parameters.description: Only return access profile provisioning links for which one of the given groups is content administrator for the system of its group on system, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the groups resource.

parameters.name: systemOwnerGroup
parameters.description: Only return access profile provisioning links for which one of the given groups is the owner of its provisioned system, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the groups resource.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.

get.summary: Query for directories in Topicus KeyHub
get.description: Query for all directories in Topicus KeyHub. The various query parameters can be used to filter the response.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Return all or no records. This can be useful when composing parameters.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created after the given instant.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created before the given instant.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the given ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter the results on the given ids.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description: Only return records that have been modified since the given instant.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter records on a complex CQL query.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only return directories that are or are not active. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: baseOrganizationalUnit
parameters.description: Filter the directories on the given base organizational unit, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the organizational unit resource.

parameters.name: defaultDirectory
parameters.description: Only return directories that are or are not the default directory.

parameters.name: expiredCertificate
parameters.description: Only return directories that use certificates that are expired at the given instant.

parameters.name: helpdeskGroup
parameters.description: Filter the directories on the given helpdesk groups, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: isNotProvisionedDirectory
parameters.description: Only return directories that are not used for source directory provisioning for the given types of linked systems.

parameters.name: maintenanceDirectory
parameters.description: Only return directories that are or are not the built-in maintenance directory.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter directories on the exact name.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filter directories on (part of) the name or uuid.

parameters.name: nameDoesNotStartWith
parameters.description: Filter directories where the name does not start with the given values.

parameters.name: nameStartsWith
parameters.description: Filter directories on the start of the name.

parameters.name: oidcVender
parameters.description: Only return OIDC directories for the given vendor(s).

parameters.name: ownedBy
parameters.description: Only return internal directories for the given owner(s), specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: tls
parameters.description: Filter LDAP directories on TLS setting(s) used.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Only return directories of the given type(s).

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Filter results on one or more UUIDs.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.

post.summary: Creates one or more new directories
post.description: Creates one or more new directories and returns the newly created directories.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

get.summary: Query for accounts in Topicus KeyHub
get.description: Query for all accounts in Topicus KeyHub. This will query over all directories and return both active and inactive accounts. The various query parameters can be used to filter the response.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Return all or no records. This can be useful when composing parameters.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created after the given instant.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created before the given instant.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the given ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter the results on the given ids.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description: Only return records that have been modified since the given instant.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter records on a complex CQL query.

parameters.name: accessProfile
parameters.description: Filter the accounts by membership of access profiles, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the access profile resource.

parameters.name: activationCode
parameters.description: Only return accounts with the given activation code(s).

parameters.name: activationDeadlineAtOrAfter
parameters.description: Only return accounts that have an activation deadline that expires at or after the given instant.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only return active or inactive accounts.

parameters.name: activeSince
parameters.description: Only return accounts that have been active since the given instant.

parameters.name: admin
parameters.description: Only return accounts that are or are not KeyHub Administrators.

parameters.name: baseOrganizationalUnitAncestorOf
parameters.description: Only return the accounts for which the base organizational unit of the directory is equal to or an ancestor of the given unit(s), specified by id.

parameters.name: directory
parameters.description: Filter the accounts by directory, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the account directory resource.

parameters.name: directoryOwnedBy
parameters.description: Only return internal accounts for directories with the given owner(s), specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Only return the accounts with the given e-mail addresses.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Filter the accounts by their registered external ids. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the 'external id' resource.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Filter the accounts by membership of groups, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: hasBeenActive
parameters.description: Only return accounts that have or have not ever been active.

parameters.name: hasEmail
parameters.description: Only return accounts that have or don't have an e-mail address.

parameters.name: hasVault
parameters.description: Only return accouts that have or don't have their vaults setup.

parameters.name: hasVaultSecretForGroup
parameters.description: Only return accounts that have access to the vault for at least one of the given groups, specified by id.

parameters.name: idInDirectory
parameters.description: Filter accounts by exact match on the id in the directory.

parameters.name: inactiveSince
parameters.description: Only return accounts that have not been active since the given instant.

parameters.name: licenseRole
parameters.description: Only return accounts with the given license role(s).

parameters.name: maintenanceAdmin
parameters.description: Only return the keyhub maintenance user.

parameters.name: managerForGroup
parameters.description: Only return managers for at least one of the given groups, specified by id.

parameters.name: memberOfOrganizationalUnit
parameters.description: Filter accounts on direct connections to organizational units, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the organizational unit resource.

parameters.name: nameDoesNotStartWith
parameters.description: Only return accounts for which the username does not start with one of the given values.

parameters.name: nameStartsWith
parameters.description: Only return accounts for which the username starts with one of the given values.

parameters.name: notInAccessProfile
parameters.description: Filter the accounts that are not a member of the given access profiles, specified by id.

parameters.name: notInGroup
parameters.description: Filter the accounts that are not a member of the given groups, specified by id.

parameters.name: owningClient
parameters.description: Filter the accounts on their 'owning' clients, specified by id. An 'owning client' is a client which can potentially modify the account. Typically this is the client which created the account (if applicable), but it could be a client which has been registered as such after the fact.

parameters.name: reregistrationRequired
parameters.description: Only return account that do or do not require reregistration.

parameters.name: rotatingPasswordEnabled
parameters.description: Only return accouts that have or don't have rotating password enabled.

parameters.name: twoFactorStatus
parameters.description: Only return accounts that match the given 2FA status. Note that {@code APP} only matches the accounts who only have a KeyHub app linked, and similar for {@code TOTP} and {@code WEBAUTHN}. {@code MIXED} matches those who have both one or more WebAuthn keys, and either a KeyHub app or generic Totp app linked.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Filter accounts on the exact username.

parameters.name: usernameContains
parameters.description: Search accounts on (part of) the username, display name or uuid.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Filter results on one or more UUIDs.

parameters.name: validInDirectory
parameters.description: Only return accounts that are valid or invalid in the directory.

parameters.name: validity
parameters.description: Filter accounts on their validity. NOT_APPLICABLE will be seen as VALID.

parameters.name: vault
parameters.description: Only return accounts that are the owner of one of the given vaults, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the vault resource.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.

parameters.description: Only return accouts that have or don't have rotating password enabled.

parameters.name: twoFactorStatus
parameters.description: Only return accounts that match the given 2FA status. Note that {@code APP} only matches the accounts who only have a KeyHub app linked, and similar for {@code TOTP} and {@code WEBAUTHN}. {@code MIXED} matches those who have both one or more WebAuthn keys, and either a KeyHub app or generic Totp app linked.

parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.

post.summary: Unlocks the user's vault
post.description: Unlocks the vault of the authenticated user. Use the session password in the response via the topicus-Vault-session header to access secrets. The prefered way to unlock a vault is via the authentication by passing 'authVault="access"' to the OAuth2 authorization endpoint.

put.summary: Updates one or more status toggles for the account
put.description: Updates one or more status toggles for the account. Only the values set will be updated on the account.

Updates multiple accounts. The given accounts will be updated according to the selected action, for example, have their license role set to the given license role, provided this matches the current license's conditions.

get.summary: Query for clients in Topicus KeyHub
get.description: Query for all clients in Topicus KeyHub. The various query parameters can be used to filter the response.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Return all or no records. This can be useful when composing parameters.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created after the given instant.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created before the given instant.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the given ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter the results on the given ids.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description: Only return records that have been modified since the given instant.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter records on a complex CQL query.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Filter clients on the client ids.

parameters.name: expiredCertificate
parameters.description: Only return LDAP clients for which the client certificate is expired at the given instant.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Filter the SSO applications connected to groups, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: isProvisionedInternalLDAP
parameters.description: Only return LDAP clients that are used as provisioned internal LDAP.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter clients on the exact name.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Search clients on (part of) the name, client id or uuid.

parameters.name: nameDoesNotStartWith
parameters.description: Only return clients for which the name does not start with one of the given values.

parameters.name: nameStartsWith
parameters.description: Only return clients for which the name starts with one of the given values.

parameters.name: notInGroup
parameters.description: Filter the SSO applications not connected to groups, specified by id.

parameters.name: organizationalUnitForEnforcement
parameters.description: Filter clients on organizational units, specified by id. This parameter is automatically set and primarily used for security permission enforcement.

parameters.name: ownedBy
parameters.description: Filter the clients for which the given group is owner, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: sharedSecret
parameters.description: Filter the clients by the secret shared in a vault, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the vault resource.

parameters.name: technicalAdministrator
parameters.description: Filter the clients for which the given group is technical administrator, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Only return clients of the given type(s).

parameters.name: useClientCredentials
parameters.description: Only return OAuth2 clients that use or do not use the client credentials grant.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Filter results on one or more UUIDs.

parameters.name: vault
parameters.description: Filter the OAuth 2.0 clients by vault, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the vault resource.

parameters.name: withPermission
parameters.description: Only return OAuth2 clients that have specific permissions, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the client permission resource.

parameters.name: withPermissionForOwningGroup
parameters.description: Filter the client applications with permissions for the given groups, either directly or via provisionedsystem ownership, specified by id.

parameters.name: withRequestedPermissionForOwningGroup
parameters.description: Filter the client applications with active requests for permissions for the given groups, either directly or via provisionedsystem ownership, specified by id.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.

post.summary: Creates one or more new clients
post.description: Creates one or more new clients and returns the newly created clients.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

get.summary: Read a single client by id
get.description: Returns the client identified by the id.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

put.description: Updates the client identified by the id.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

delete.description: Permanently removes the client identified by the id. This cannot be undone.

get.summary: Read a single permission by id
get.description: Returns the permission identified by the id.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

delete.description: Deletes the permission identified by the id.

get.summary: Query for permissions on OAuth2 clients in Topicus KeyHub
get.description: Query for all permissions given to a OAuth2 client in Topicus KeyHub. The various query parameters can be used to filter the response.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

parameters.name: any
parameters.description: Return all or no records. This can be useful when composing parameters.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created after the given instant.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created before the given instant.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the given ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter the results on the given ids.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description: Only return records that have been modified since the given instant.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter records on a complex CQL query.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Filter permissions on the clients to which they are given, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the client resource.

parameters.name: forGroup
parameters.description: Filter permissions on the groups to which they apply, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the group resource.

parameters.name: forSystem
parameters.description: Filter permissions on the systems to which they apply, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the system resource.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Filter permissions on the permission type(s).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.

post.summary: Rotate the secret for the current OAuth2 client
post.description: The given secret will be verified and a new secret generated and returned.

post.summary: Unlocks the client's vault
post.description: Unlocks the vault of the authenticated client. Use the session password in the response via the topicus-Vault-session header to access secrets. The prefered way to unlock a vault is via the authentication by passing 'authVault="access"' to the OAuth2 token endpoint.

get.summary: Read a vault with its records
get.description: Returns the vault. It is not possible to read the secrets, for this the records need to be read one by one.

delete.description: Delete the personal vault of the current user.

get.summary: Returns a random generated password
get.description: Returns a random generated password using the given strategy, or the default strategy if none given.

get.summary: Returns a random generated value
get.description: Returns a random generated value of the given length, default 24.

get.summary: Query for records in a vault
get.description: Query for vault records in a specific vault. The various query parameters can be used to filter the response. It is not possible to access secrets with a query that returns multiple results. Secrets can only be read one by one.

parameters.name: color

parameters.name: group

parameters.name: hasNoPolicy

parameters.name: hasParent

parameters.name: hasValidPolicy
parameters.description: Only return records that have or do not have expired.

parameters.name: name

parameters.name: parent

parameters.name: secret

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.

post.summary: Creates one or more new records in a vault
post.description: Creates one or more new vault records and returns the newly created records. Secrets are specified via the additional object secret. It is required to specify the 'topicus-Vault-session' header. When updating a TOTP-secret, make sure to set 'writeTotp' field.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

get.summary: Read a single record by id
get.description: Returns the vault record identified by the id. When the 'secret' additonal object is requested, the 'topicus-Vault-session' header must be specified.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

put.description: Updates the vault record identified by the id. To update the secrets, the 'secret' additional object must be used, in addition to specifying the 'topicus-Vault-session' header. When updating a TOTP-secret, make sure to set 'writeTotp' field.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Request additional information to be returned for every record.

delete.description: Removes the vault record identified by the id. This cannot be undone.

post.summary: Move, copy or share a vault record
post.description: Move, copy or share the vault record specified by the given id to/with a different vault. For this, the 'topicus-Vault-session' header must be set.

post.summary: Prepares an export of vault records in CSV format
post.description: Prepares an export of vault records using the filtering specified in the query parameters. The URI of the export can be found in the returned Location header. This URI is valid for 2 minutes after being generated.

parameters.description: Filter groups on whether they are public or only visible to members. Possible values are ALL ("return all groups (public and hidden)"), PUBLIC ("return only public groups") and PUBLIC_OR_MEMBER ("return public groups and hidden groups of which the current subject is a member"). Possible values are ALL ("return all groups (public and hidden)"), PUBLIC ("return only public groups") and PUBLIC_OR_MEMBER ("return public groups and hidden groups of which the current subject is a member"). parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return records that have been created before the given instant.

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the given ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Filter the results on the given ids.

parameters.name: modifiedSince
parameters.description: Only return records that have been modified since the given instant.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filter records on a complex CQL query.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given accounts, specified by id.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Only return active or inactive webhooks.

parameters.name: appAdminGroup
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given groups performing technical administration for the client for the webhooks, specified by id.

parameters.name: appOwnerGroup
parameters.description: Filter the webhooks by groups owning the client, specified by id.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given clients, specified by id.

parameters.name: contentAdminGroup
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given groups performing content administration for the system for the webhooks, specified by id.

parameters.name: directory
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given directories, specified by id.

parameters.name: directoryOwnerGroup
parameters.description: Filter the webhooks by groups owning the internal directory, specified by id.

parameters.name: expiredCertificate
parameters.description: Only return webhooks that use certificates that are expired at the given instant.

parameters.name: global
parameters.description: Only return webhooks that are or are not global.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given groups, specified by id.

parameters.name: nameContains
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on (part of) the name, uuid or URL.

parameters.name: serviceAccount
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given service accounts, specified by id.

parameters.name: serviceAccountNotNull
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given service accounts, specified by id. This parameter supports composition with all parameters from the provisioning group resource.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given systems, specified by id.

parameters.name: systemAdminGroup
parameters.description: Filter webhooks on the given groups performing technical administration for the system for the webhooks, specified by id.

parameters.name: systemOwnerGroup
parameters.description: Filter the webhooks by groups owning the provisioned system, specified by id.

parameters.name: tls
parameters.description: Filter results on the given TLS mode(s).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Only return webhooks that trigger on one of the given type(s).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Filter results on one or more URLs.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Filter results on one or more UUIDs.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the items. Use 'asc-<name>' for ascending and 'desc-<name>' for descending order.
